original_solution_mapping.L1: 65% of women are opposed to the idea because 100 - 35 = <<100-35=65>>65
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are 60 women in the poll because 39 / .65 = <<39/.65=60>>60
original_solution_mapping.L3: There were 120 people in her poll because 60 / .5 = <<60/.5=120>>120

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6564.
    Returns: the total number of people polled.
    """
    # L1
    total_percent = 100 # WK
    women_in_favor_percent = 35 # 35% of women are in favor
    women_opposed_percent = total_percent - women_in_favor_percent

    # L2
    women_opposed_count = 39 # 39 women in her poll opposed this idea
    women_opposed_decimal = 0.65 # from solution text: .65
    total_women_polled = women_opposed_count / women_opposed_decimal

    # L3
    women_percentage_of_total = 0.5 # 50% women
    total_people_polled = total_women_polled / women_percentage_of_total

    # FA
    answer = total_people_polled
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 65% of women are opposed to the idea because {total_percent} - {women_in_favor_percent} = <<{total_percent}-{women_in_favor_percent}={women_opposed_percent}>>{women_opposed_percent}
There are {total_women_polled} women in the poll because {women_opposed_count} / {women_opposed_decimal} = <<{women_opposed_count}/{women_opposed_decimal}={total_women_polled}>>{total_women_polled}

There were {total_people_polled} people in her poll because {total_women_polled} / {women_percentage_of_total} = <<{total_women_polled}/{women_percentage_of_total}={total_people_polled}>>{total_people_polled}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 65% of women are opposed to the idea because 100 - 35 = <<100-35=65>>65
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: There are 60 women in the poll because 39 / 0.65 = <<39/0.65=60>>60
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: There were 78 people in her poll because 39 / 0.5 = <<39/0.5=78>>78

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'women_opposed_count' (value: 39) was used instead of 'total_women_polled' (value: 60.0).
